title: WWF logo font
content:
Hi..

Do anyone know which font is used in the WWF logo? My guess would be Clarice Black but I am not sure.

Can anyone make me wiser? :)

Thx :D

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [,.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304194517/http:/typophile.com/files/,.png) | 5.18 KB |
author: damm1990

comments.content:
Larger image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304194517im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WWF_6078.jpg)
  
Not Clarice Black and probably a custom design.  
The base letters may have been derived from a font like Radiant Black  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/radiant/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304194517/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/radiant/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/radiant/fonts/")  
or Castle Ultra  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?2MG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304194517/http:/www.identifont.com/show?2MG "http://www.identifont.com/show?2MG")  
using overlapping Vs to make a W with the center strokes meeting in a "T" to the left, and rounding the corners of the Ws and F to make soft and "friendly" letters.  
Don

Hi damn1990,  
Definitely not Clarice Black and Don's probably right about it being a custom logotype (registered ®), but pretty simple though - all straight lines and circles.  
There is some info and a video about the WWF logo and it's development here:  
 [http://www.logodesignlove.com/world-wildlife-fund](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304194517/http:/www.logodesignlove.com/world-wildlife-fund "http://www.logodesignlove.com/world-wildlife-fund")

I also noticed your other request regarding other "WWF lungs typo" info, so I feel I should refer you to the info available from their website in respect of using site content. This is the legal bit, I guess!  
 [http://wwf.panda.org/using\_site\_content/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304194517/http:/wwf.panda.org/using_site_content/ "http://wwf.panda.org/using\_site\_content/")

Hope this helps  
Doghouse

Can't say exactly why but looks like somebody played with [Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150304194517/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot) and the more I look at it the more I think it's a manually rounded version of it (which to me looks very bad)...
